body:
There are two issues here I think:
1. Even though `isChunk` allows `split`s, this conditional will remove them (idk if that's desirable in our case, but it doesn't seem so).
2. It's better to use the `->matches(...)` syntax, and that allows you to specify a list of attributes you expect to be constant too.
body_html:
There are two issues here I think:

  1. Even though isChunk allows splits, this conditional will remove them (idk if that's desirable in our case, but it doesn't seem so).
  2. It's better to use the ->matches(...) syntax, and that allows you to specify a list of attributes you expect to be constant too.
body_text:
There are two issues here I think:

Even though isChunk allows splits, this conditional will remove them (idk if that's desirable in our case, but it doesn't seem so).
It's better to use the ->matches(...) syntax, and that allows you to specify a list of attributes you expect to be constant too.
